entry.title: John Cowans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that British prime minister H. H. Asquith described John Cowans (pictured) as "the best Quartermaster since Moses"?

entry.title: a 150-year-old mosque (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that historians oppose the removal of a 150-year-old mosque in New Delhi for alleged traffic congestion, citing its cultural significance?

entry.title: Bernard Descôteaux (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Canadian journalist Bernard Descôteaux is credited with the economic revival of the independent newspaper Le Devoir?

entry.title: a Virginia TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Virginia TV station made payroll early on by trading in car titles for cash?

entry.title: Pierre St. Germain (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Métis guide Pierre St. Germain was forced to remain with an Arctic expedition he considered too dangerous?

entry.title: songs recorded by Ben&Ben (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that songs recorded by Ben&Ben will be featured in the musical adaptation of the film One More Chance?

entry.title: Mount Churchill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mount Churchill, a volcano in Alaska, distributed ash as far as Europe and may have driven migration from Canada to southwestern North America?

entry.title: He Tianzhang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although the Jesuit missionary He Tianzhang despised his "sad Chinese appearance", it allowed him to circumvent the Qing's ban on Christianity and enter China?
